issue.title: Downgrade chalk to v2.2.2 due to undefined issue

repository.name: create-cozy-app
repository.description: A CLI to bootstrap a "zero-configuration" application for the Cozy V3 platform

issue.body:
Issue:

```
myapptest/node_modules/cozy-scripts/node_modules/chalk/index.js:82
				const open = ansiStyles.color[levelMapping[level]][model].apply(null, arguments);
				                                                  ^

TypeError: Cannot read property 'hex' of undefined
    at Function.<anonymous> (myapptest/node_modules/cozy-scripts/node_modules/chalk/index.js:82:55)
    at Object.<anonymous> (myapptest/node_modules/cozy-scripts/utils/_colorize.js:7:15)
    at Module._compile (module.js:643:30)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:654:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:556:32)
    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:499:12)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:491:3)
    at Module.require (module.js:587:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:11:18)
```

See https://github.com/chalk/chalk/issues/248

issue.title: fix(deps): update dependency chalk to v2.3.1

repository.name: create-cozy-app
repository.description: A CLI to bootstrap a "zero-configuration" application for the Cozy V3 platform

issue.body:
This Pull Request updates dependency [chalk](https://github.com/chalk/chalk) from `v2.3.0` to `v2.3.1`



<details>
<summary>Release Notes</summary>

### [`v2.3.1`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/releases/v2.3.1)

- Calculate proper `level` when forcing color. https://github.com/chalk/supports-color/commit/b16e9a4b9f13b3930e184e2f582b55091216fe47
- Detect 16m color support on Windows >=10.0.14931. https://github.com/chalk/supports-color/commit/cf7bd05b814246e76c7f09bdb8e14a2ee581a2dd

---

</details>


<details>
<summary>Commits</summary>

#### v2.3.1
-   [`5392313`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/539231341426d4b3951b062e806123137b452bf7) Correct HSV and HWB examples
-   [`a8c60e3`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/a8c60e37fa5fd9024c727e296bd24c37f7d725d1) Fix spelling error in readme (#​232)
-   [`bc3dd75`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/bc3dd75329b43eeda3200ac9a161b6e5a9b9dfe3) Update usage stats in the readme (#​242)
-   [`6554030`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/655403055099299cc8c5053af970366d0c4c32b7) Use svg screenshot
-   [`011dd04`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/011dd0421e14b21a07392b8d9d28ba9e851397b4) Fix usage example in the readme (#​251)
-   [`678152c`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/678152cf1952f3afe1e523a306c0413ad57c34b3) Update chalk to use the latest updates to supports-color (#​247)
-   [`b55dd79`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/b55dd79f8bbd37725de562ce7422cd3ba8c87c3e) Force bump dependencies
-   [`ae8a03f`](https://github.com/chalk/chalk/commit/ae8a03f2c5c49896adeb3dd4ec5350e4ab9449a2) 2.3.1

</details>



---

issue.title: No .ansi256 in 256-color level; .apply not safe
issue.body:
Hello.

When running this code on Windows Command Prompt:

```
console.log(chalk.ansi256(ansiColor)(whateverString));
```

I get this error:
```
E:\Projetos\outros\teste_sl\geralargos\node_modules\chalk\index.js:82
                                const open = ansiStyles.color[levelMapping[level]][model].apply(null, arguments);
                                                                                         ^

TypeError: Cannot read property 'apply' of undefined
    at Function.<anonymous> (E:\Projetos\outros\teste_sl\geralargos\node_modules\chalk\index.js:82:62)
    at slimes.forEach.slime (E:\Projetos\outros\teste_sl\geralargos\index.js:75:75)
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at parseFile (E:\Projetos\outros\teste_sl\geralargos\index.js:72:12)
    at tryToString (fs.js:514:3)
    at FSReqWrap.readFileAfterClose [as oncomplete] (fs.js:502:12)
```

So I tried to debug that particular line and found something.
`levelMapping` contains an ordered array with four elements: "ansi", "ansi", "ansi256" and "ansi16m", respectively 0,1,2 and 3. 
`level` contains the number representing current terminal's color level.
`model` contains the function name of the used color model.
`ansiStyles.color` contains all the named foreground and background colors "constants" (i.e. they contain start and end closure declarations), as well as groups called "ansi", "ansi256" and "ansi16m".
Occurred that, in "256 colors" mode, there is no function called ansi256, whereas both "ansi16m" and "ansi" does have it. And, as it is dynamically defined by current level, there is no checking of existence of object `ansiStyles.color[levelMapping[level]][model]` on line 82.

So, why 256 color mode lacks `ansi256` function? 
And the calling to `.apply` there is not safe.

body:
The last version of chalk `2.3.1` seems to fix my issue. What about on your side @danfuzz ?
__Edit:__ Testing your previous code, the issue seems to be still here with the level 4 usage.

@CPatchane: Yeah, I just confirmed that the problem is still present as well. Thanks for checking, too.

For convenient testing: https://runkit.com/embed/381v97r9x8mx
There is no such thing as level 4. Why are you testing for it?
Oh, my apologies. I thought it went to 4. (By way of suggestion, maybe the constructor should throw if given a bogus level.)

> maybe the constructor should throw if given a bogus level

Agreed. Feel free to PR :)
